messages.subject: Re: anoooo...
messages.msgSnippet: Okay, I feel really stupid, but I joined because I wanted to read/post fanfiction about the Shinsengumi. I saw something on the main page about business lists
messages.messageBody:
Okay, I feel really stupid, but I joined because I wanted to read/post fanfiction about the Shinsengumi. I saw something on the main page about business lists and files, and here again you mention group files, but I can't find anything that says "files" or "fanfic" or "fiction folder" or anything of the kind. While it's entirely possible that I'm a) retarded or b) blind, I find it very frustrating that this isn't more obvious when that's supposed to be the major reason for the group. Or so the listing on Shinsengumi HQ said. Help?

Thanks,
Pen

--- In SHQ_Spy_Division@yahoogroups.com, BarbaraSheridan <bsher213@...> wrote:
>
>
>
> Katsuhiro Shourin wrote:
>
> >
> >can you send any fanfiction. i made a few and i want people to read
> >and gives comment... soooo.. how? where should i go?
> >
> >
> Your story has to contain at least one Shinsengumi character but ti can
> be from any "universe" Kenshin Peace Maker Kurogane, the NHK Taiga
> drama, historical, films etc.
>
>
>
> Here are the guidelines as they appear in the group files section
>
>
>
> *Submitting Fiction*
>
>
>
> Stories and poetry can be posted to the list or uploaded into the
> Fiction folder under Files, or both. When you post to the list,
> formatting will usually be lost. Saving your story or poem as an html
> document enables you to format a story the way you want and have it be
> seen that way. Just keep readability in mind when you get enthusiastic
> with color and fonts. J (In MSWord, to save a document in html format,
> you can either choose the "Save as" feature under File and choose "web
> page" in the drop down menu OR again under File, click on "Save as web
> document." Those of us accustomed to uploading stories on ff.net should
> be aware that uploading to the yahoo list site keeps formatting exactly
> as you save it, unlike ff.net which puts lines in after returns. It's
> been ages since I've worked with WordPerfect, so I don't know how it
> works, but I imagine it's similar. Send a query to the list for help if
> you need to.)
>
>
>
> If the story or poem is being posted to the list, in the subject line,
> please provide the following FIC: <title>, <source material>, <character
> or pairing>, <rating>
>
>
>
> As an example, using one of my Rurouni Kenshin stories: FIC: Kitaku,
> RK, SaitouxSano, R
>
>
>
> You can use semi-colons to separate the information or put non-title
> information within parentheses, etc., but include the information so
> others can see at a glance if it is something they're interested in.
> With so much potential diversity of characters, situations, and source
> materials, it's only common courtesy.
>
>
>
> Please include the following header when posting a story to the list or
> uploading it to the File folder. I know it's a pain, but it allows
> readers the choice of what they want to read and what they want to
> avoid, as well as quick access to author information, permission to
> archive on the website, and a disclaimer to protect yourself. Stories
> that are posted without the header will be deleted. Forgetfulness
> happens --- don't take it personally. Just repost it with the header.
> (Or just send a message that, ACK! you forgot the header and correct it
> on the upload in Files.) If the story contains multiple parts or
> chapters, you can either repost the header each time or at the very
> least repost the disclaimer. If information should change (such as the
> story has suddenly jumped from PG to R), please repost a new header when
> you realize information in the original header has changed. If you have
> any questions, feel free to contact me, spiritus_saitou@...
> <mailto:spiritus_saitou@...> .
>
>
>
> *Title*:
>
> *Author*:
>
> *E-mail*:
>
> *Source*: (original, RK, PMK, Mibugishiden, etc.)
>
> *Main character(s*): (Shinsengumi, Okita, SaitouxTokio, Kondou &
> Hijikata, just give us an idea of who we're going to read about)
>
> *Archived on the website: *(Is it okay to archive it on the SHQ
> website, yes or no)
>
> *General Rating*: (G, PG, PG-13, R, NC-17... I know it's hard to
> estimate, but a general idea helps)
>
> *Warning*: (M/M, F/M, F/F sexual situations, graphic violence, strong
> language, rape... anything you think might be disturbing)
>
> *Disclaimer*: (If you are using characterizations drawn from a
> copyrighted source (such as anime, manga, film, books), you must
> acknowledge you do not hold the copyright. If your story is based on an
> original idea with original characters, give yourself at least a little
> protection from potential plagiarism by stating you own the rights to
> your original ideas and characters.)
>
>
> --
> Barbara Sheridan
> http://www.barbarasheridan.net
> The Blog-- http://barbarasheridan.blogspot.com/
>
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: RE: [SHQ_Spy_Division] anoooo...

messages.messageBody:
Post it here. That's what the list is for!

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ_Spy_Division] anoooo...
messages.msgSnippet: ... Your story has to contain at least one Shinsengumi character but ti can be from any universe Kenshin Peace Maker Kurogane, the NHK Taiga drama,
messages.messageBody:
Katsuhiro Shourin wrote:

>
>can you send any fanfiction. i made a few and i want people to read
>and gives comment... soooo.. how? where should i go?
>
>
Your story has to contain at least one Shinsengumi character but ti can
be from any "universe" Kenshin Peace Maker Kurogane, the NHK Taiga
drama, historical, films etc.



Here are the guidelines as they appear in the group files section



*Submitting Fiction*



Stories and poetry can be posted to the list or uploaded into the
Fiction folder under Files, or both. When you post to the list,
formatting will usually be lost. Saving your story or poem as an html
document enables you to format a story the way you want and have it be
seen that way. Just keep readability in mind when you get enthusiastic
with color and fonts. J (In MSWord, to save a document in html format,
you can either choose the "Save as" feature under File and choose "web
page" in the drop down menu OR again under File, click on "Save as web
document." Those of us accustomed to uploading stories on ff.net should
be aware that uploading to the yahoo list site keeps formatting exactly
as you save it, unlike ff.net which puts lines in after returns. It's
been ages since I've worked with WordPerfect, so I don't know how it
works, but I imagine it's similar. Send a query to the list for help if
you need to.)



If the story or poem is being posted to the list, in the subject line,
please provide the following FIC: <title>, <source material>, <character
or pairing>, <rating>



As an example, using one of my Rurouni Kenshin stories: FIC: Kitaku,
RK, SaitouxSano, R



You can use semi-colons to separate the information or put non-title
information within parentheses, etc., but include the information so
others can see at a glance if it is something they're interested in.
With so much potential diversity of characters, situations, and source
materials, it's only common courtesy.



Please include the following header when posting a story to the list or
uploading it to the File folder. I know it's a pain, but it allows
readers the choice of what they want to read and what they want to
avoid, as well as quick access to author information, permission to
archive on the website, and a disclaimer to protect yourself. Stories
that are posted without the header will be deleted. Forgetfulness
happens --- don't take it personally. Just repost it with the header.
(Or just send a message that, ACK! you forgot the header and correct it
on the upload in Files.) If the story contains multiple parts or
chapters, you can either repost the header each time or at the very
least repost the disclaimer. If information should change (such as the
story has suddenly jumped from PG to R), please repost a new header when
you realize information in the original header has changed. If you have
any questions, feel free to contact me, spiritus_saitou@...
<mailto:spiritus_saitou@...> .



*Title*:

*Author*:

*E-mail*:

*Source*: (original, RK, PMK, Mibugishiden, etc.)

*Main character(s*): (Shinsengumi, Okita, SaitouxTokio, Kondou &
Hijikata, just give us an idea of who we're going to read about)

*Archived on the website: *(Is it okay to archive it on the SHQ
website, yes or no)

*General Rating*: (G, PG, PG-13, R, NC-17... I know it's hard to
estimate, but a general idea helps)

*Warning*: (M/M, F/M, F/F sexual situations, graphic violence, strong
language, rape... anything you think might be disturbing)

*Disclaimer*: (If you are using characterizations drawn from a
copyrighted source (such as anime, manga, film, books), you must
acknowledge you do not hold the copyright. If your story is based on an
original idea with original characters, give yourself at least a little
protection from potential plagiarism by stating you own the rights to
your original ideas and characters.)


--
Barbara Sheridan
http://www.barbarasheridan.net
The Blog-- http://barbarasheridan.blogspot.com/
